title: Mastery of Instructional Design Research Methodologies: Case-Based Social Learning Environment and Civic Competency Strengthening Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design theory and educational program development experience. Basic understanding of organizational development, leadership theories, and social learning theories (social capital, civic competencies)
context.additional_context: A blended environment combining smartphone-based online learning and bi-monthly offline workshops for HRD professionals and leadership development experts within enterprises. Focuses on acquiring research methodologies applicable to real workplaces, with particular emphasis on strengthening organizational culture, civic consciousness, social relationships, and sustainable learning environments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core features and differences of four instructional design research methodologies (case study, design-based research) in the context of social learning (organizational culture, civic capacity building).

Learners can write an ADDIE model-based instructional design research plan for enhancing job competencies within an organization, submit a 10-page report including a 3-phase (analysis-design-development) implementation plan, and receive approval of 80/100 or higher from an internal evaluation committee, considering organizational culture, civic capacity, and social relationship-building elements.

Learners can collect data from over 20 participants using three or more data collection/analysis tools (Google Forms, SurveyMonkey, Google Data Studio) in a smartphone environment, visualize the data, and derive at least three key insights, particularly analyzing organizational relationships and collaboration patterns (civic awareness, social interactions).

Learners can write a research report meeting summative evaluation criteria, including recommendations for building a learning organization, designing sustainable education systems, and strengthening social capital.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
